line-7: Job Title Cost Planning AssistantLocation Anywhere on the Network Rail Wales and Western RegionDepartment Name Cost Planning & Estimating within the Commercial Services DeptAbout Network RailAt Network Rail, we’re part of a large family serving millions of passengers and freight users throughout the UK every day. Our service impacts millions of people and we strive to become more efficient as we enhance, maintain, and operate our network.Our passengers and freight users are at the heart of everything we do. We help connect people to their friends and families and get goods to their destination safely and efficiently. We’re an organisation where people matter. When you're part of our team, you matter to us, and you matter to millions. Watch our video to find out more!The Wales & Western region includes more than 2,700 miles of railway and we serve communities and businesses of Wales, the Thames Valley, West of England, and the Southwest Peninsula.Our ambition to be responsive to passengers and freight users drives us every day and we're empowered to do the right thing for those who use the rail network. We actively challenge unsafe practices and take responsibility for addressing risks, resolving issues, and protecting safety and wellbeing.About the DepartmentThe Cost Planning & Estimating team supports the Wales & Western regional delivery and development organisations providing high quality estimates across a wide range of projects used to securing internal and external funding. We provide a benchmarking service to assist the pre and post contact commercial teams to secure best value outcomes. We also work closely with the other regional Cost Planning & Estimating teams and the Rail Industry Centre of Excellent who oversee the businesses benchmarking activity.About our people and the recruitment process - We’re an inclusive employer of choice and we welcome applications from everyone! As a Network Rail employee, you will enjoy a wide range of benefits including: · Privileged staff travel - Leisure travel discount of 75% on all leisure travel and includes family members.· A subsidy of up to 75% on rail and underground season tickets if you travel to work on the train.· GWR ticket alliance – Heavily discounted all day passes for you and up to 5 friends and family to use across the GWR network (20 passes per year)· A range of Pension schemes to choose from
line-9: To assist in the preparation of estimates and cost plans including preparing and inputting benchmarking information. Provide commercial management support to the cost planning and estimating team.
line-11: Responsibilities Assist in the development of accurate and comprehensive cost plans for simple projects in accordance with the Cost Planning policies, processes and the Governance for the Project Acceleration in a Controlled Environment (PACE). Assist in the development of cost plans in accordance with the Rail Method of Measurement format and structure. Assist in the production of cost plan reports in accordance with the Cost Planning policies and processes to support the basis of all cost plans. Assist in the completion and submission of rail work activity based cost model cost data through the BenchSmart benchmarking system. Actively pursue self-development and professional training relevant to future career progression to become Cost Planning Manager within a maximum of three years. Awareness of the development and use of Unit Cost Modelling for railway based work activities. Awareness of Risk and Value Management techniques to derive Risk Allowances during the development and design stages of a project lifecycle. Assist in the production of Life Cycle Costs through the use of the Cost Benefit Asset Lifecycle Tool (CoBALT). Awareness of how cost planning techniques are used in the financial control of projects during the development and design stages of a project. Understanding of Commercial Policies and Governance Essential · An awareness of Cost Planning and Estimating processes and techniques. · An awareness of Cost Analysis, Cost Modelling and Benchmarking processes and techniques. · Previous experience of quantity surveying services. · Qualified or working towards a basic standard in Cost Planning, Estimating and / or Quantity Surveying. · Experience in the construction industry. · An understanding of the project management, planning, risk assessments and management, and investment authority processes associated with building and / or civil engineering infrastructure projects. · Good communication, analytical, presentation and reporting skills. Desirable · Qualified or working towards a basic standard in Cost Planning, Estimating and / or Quantity Surveying. · Qualified or working towards a professional standard in cost planning, estimating and quantity surveying through membership of the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors (RICS) or equivalent body. · Knowledge of appropriate Cost Planning and Estimating computer software systems. · Educated to Degree level.
